content.description: Start right hand just above head hight on crimp near right side of boulder.  Left hand on either of the slanting side pulls.  Smear right foot on high, throw left hand high to the pinch above.  Slap up the boulder with your right hand (avoiding the boulder to the right) and work your way to the jug to top out.
content.protection: A few pads and one or two spotters.
content.location: Just to the right of Mushroom tattoo on the same boulder.

content.description: A neat little problem that's quite different from the standard Hunters fare.  Start on the obvious start hold with bad feet, move to the horizontal crack, traverse right, and top it out.  Fairly blank rock on this one.
content.protection: Short problem with a flat landing
content.location: Slightly down the hill (towards the road) from the campfire area

content.description: Verbing, v6: This problem was a v4 before a crucial hold broke.  Same start as Cockblock. Climb until you can traverse left to the good crimp on Standard American Accent... top out the same as S.A.A.
content.location: Start on the right arete of the Standard American Boulder.

content.description: Tape up, wear long sleeves, and prepare to do battle with some off width. The crux is getting off the ground up the first ~6 feet of the crack until you're secure. Then get ready for the inch by inch wiggle/struggle fest to finish. Super quality rock and climbing very unique for Hunter's.
content.location: Lat: 40.548994Long: -77.864002On the trail headed toward incredarete turn off to the right a bit early before you head down the hill very much. You'll recognize this beast when you see it.

content.description: just down hill from the mojo.... the right hand wall just before you walk through the cave... highball... good finish for resin run.
Highball arete that faces the firepit clearing up the hill from Standard American Accent
content.protection: Multiple pads - this is tall and probably sandy.
content.location: Arete faces the firepit clearing up the hill from Standard American Accent.  Behind and to the right from Saddle Sore.

content.description:
Most Popular version (v7): Stand start (may need to stack pads for shorter climbers to reach the starting holds), left in obvious round pocket out left, right in sidepull pocket, right heel up and cross left hand to crimp, top out straight up.  

  Original start (v8-9): stand start in the middle of the overhanging boulder, left hand in break, right directly above in sidepull pocket, right foot up, cross left hand to crimp...helps to be really strong, really flexible, and shorter for this variation. Can also start matched in the break for added difficulty, but this makes one feel like a human cork screw and it is very seldom sent this way.
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads and a good spotter
content.location:
The center of the Standard American Boulder - From the main parking area on Frew Rd. follow the main trail and bear left at the crest of the hill (first sightings of main boulders). 

  While this boulder is on public land, continuing the trail any further downhill will lead to private land.

content.description: Start in the gulley to the immediate right of Vedauwoo Dropout. Walk/shimmy your way up. Unfortunately the crux comes at the very top of this thing where it narrows considerably. Throw a pad down if you like but because this thing goes so far IN as it goes UP, the worst of a fall will likely not be protected by pad. A bit contrived maybe, but good fun and a stiff test of your mental game. Do best not to hang on the tree.
content.location: Directly right of Vedauwoo Dropout

content.description: small boulder behind resin run... start on two crimps low and under the overhang, throw right to a crimp and work the lip of the boulder till you can grab the pinches under the point of the overhang... then throw for the lip
Climb obvious face, steep but juggy. Topout is pretty tall and not quite as easy as the rest of the climbing.
content.protection: either bring confidence or a few pads and spotters.
content.location: At the top of the main trail in (where it either continues down left to the Standard American Boulder or forks right) follow the trail right until you hit the old fire ring.  Look up and to your left and you should see the Saddle Sore overhanging, juggy face.

content.description: walk through the cave below the mojo... large wall on the right... traverse from left to right... can end on teraplata (v4) on the uphill side of the cave.
content.location: walk through the cave below the mojo...  it's on the right

content.description: traverse the lip of the cave just down hill from incredarete...left to right. step off when you can.

Stand start right hand at the brown hold at head height, left near the tree up high.  Slap and bearhug your way up sidepull slopers and muffin crimps to the top. The topout is easier than the beginning and middle sections, but the consequences of screwing it up are much higher. More like V5 if taller and conditions make a big difference on this one.
content.protection: A few well placed pads and some spotters as the topout of this has a pretty bad landing.
content.location: From the fire pit, follow the trail right over a few small boulders.  The Horsepens boulder will be on your right.  Directly across from it is the Mother of All Highballs boulder (the tallest one in eyeshot).  Walk towards the Mother boulder and past it on the left, over various boulders, down the hill.  Before dropping off the rock onto soil there will be a slightly overhanging face with a tree on the left side of it (it faces directly away from the direction you came from).  There are two rails at arm's width apart that run up the boulder.

content.description: Sit start below the mushroom shape roof, climb up through the hueco's to a good hold on the lip of the roof. Now work up to a sloper and mantle over to the top.
content.location: If you are facing the 'Horsepens Boulder' look right and you will see this obvious line

content.description: Climb the slabby left side of the boulder - to the left of Incredarete.  This might be a bit mossy - it doesn't get climbed very often.
content.location: To the left of Incredarete on the Standard American Boulder.

content.description: on the way to mushroom tattoo... just as you start down the backside of the hill... veer right and find the egg like boulder with a great jug start... throw for the top... to the left of the start you can see some highballs... that face downhill towards the road..
start on two pocket and a big throw to a rail, then work the rail and stand up to grab big jug and high topout..
content.location: When walking towards mojo this boulder will be on your left down the trail from incredarete.

content.description: Start low on Incredarete at obvious break/jug, long reach right to rounded small crimp with bite, cross left hand to the round pocket (the start of Standard American Accent), right hand to break in middle of boulder below the Standard American Accent sidepull pocket, square up feet, right hand up to sidepull pocket, finish as S.A.A..
content.protection: 2-3 pads and a spotter for the top/pad moving
content.location: Starts at low end of the left arete on the Standard American Boulder.

content.description: Start on pockets on the left arete (sit start optional).  Move up the arete using pinches and slopers.  The crux is at the crest of the overhang.  Topout is tall, but juggy.
content.protection: 1-3 pads depending on how solid you are at the grade.
content.location: Left arete of the Standard American Boulder.

content.description:
Sit start at the middle of the sideways 'y' formation, left hand on the shelf-like hold, climb up and work left up the sloping face, walking your feet over on the rail below. 

  (v3 variation: start matched on the crimp below the 'y' formation.)
content.location: Just up the small hill (away from Saddle Sore and the Sweet Arete) from the firepit clearing.  The boulder will be on your right (turn to look back in the direction of the road down in the gully).

content.description:
A fun arete and face climb. 

  Sit start on a good left hand pinch and right on the arete, pick some feet at toss right hand up to a unique pinch on the arete. Then toss out left to the jug in the middle of the face and top out up and left.
content.location: With your back to the 'Horsepens Boulder' head down hill this will be the first overhanging face or your left.

content.description: Pull off high holds at the lip and continue over steep rock to the top. I threw a massive reverse flag to the horizontal, but you can be more static if lame is your game.
content.protection: One pad and confidence or two pads and a friend.
content.location: If I have my bearings right: when at the campfire ring, it's the really rectangular/thin tall boi on your left. Problem's on the backside. If my bearings are wrong, you'll be climbing a fun problem anyway and teach me how to use a guidebook.

content.description: Originally sent with only the right climbing shoe on. Its the second "crack" to the right of vedauwoo dropout. Start on wide hands and fists and work up to off width,
content.location: Right of vedauwoo dropout.

content.description:
Stand start on the right arete with a high right-hand undercling and a left-hand crimp on the face of the wall. Climb all the way to the top using pockets, gastons, and slopers.  Top out at highest point on boulder. 

  Fair warning: This boulder problem is tall and scary at the top.
content.location: The right arete on the standard american boulder.

content.description: Start same as S.A.A. Left foot up to small knob and throw left hand up left to sloper/dish (below Incredarete), match left heel to sloper and bump left hand sloper sidepull (optional: go again left to really sandy handlebar hold one foot above), right hand to sloper in the middle of the S.A.A. topout...topout as S.A.A. This is a really fun eliminate problem.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the Standard American Boulder.

content.description: The main area at Hunter's Rocks.
